intro: Pavonia aristata, commonly known as the Mexican bush bean, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a slight red or purple tint. Its botanical features include showy, pea-like blooms and a fibrous root system that helps it thrive in well-drained soils. Pavonia aristata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to full sun to partial shade conditions.
